issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Part of the 4.0.1 testing includes forcing a PV image conversion to fail at different stages in the conversion process and test the state of the image and imaging service post failure. 
For this test I've terminated the imaging worker VM during a conversion task. The result is the task goes to failed, and the image's tags represent the failure. The next run-instance request for this EMI causes the conversion task to be added back to the task queue and retried. These subsequent attempts fail.

Potential problems:
-The logs (shown below) seem to show the next conversion attempt fails during the upload-bundle request due to a repeated 204 response not being handled? 
-The task is again retried but the working dir is not cleaned up and it looks like there may not be space on the imaging-worker-vm to complete future tasks?
-The last failure results in the task being removed from the queue and no longer retried until another run request is issued by a user. This leaves the previous instance requests hung in pending state for 2 hours when they will finally timeout. 


I'm attempting to reproduce and gather more debug to post the ticket. 
Thanks, 
-M

Imaging worker log
{code}
